matched_top_1_cdm_definition: An alphanumeric identifier assigned to a specific patient.
The assemblage of physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female; the physical difference between male and female; the distinguishing peculiarity of male or female.
The year in which a person was born.

cohort_definition: Years of formal education subject received
matched_top_1_cdm_definition: The number of education years that a subject has competed.

cohort_definition: Long-form variable for the patient's current living accommodation
matched_top_1_cdm_definition: A description of a personal residence and the relationship between the occupants that reside there.

cohort_definition: Long-form variable for status of Alcohol use
matched_top_1_cdm_definition: Consumption of liquids containing ethanol, including the behaviors associated with drinking the alcohol.

cohort_definition: Long-form variable for disease code for any selected diagnoses as the response to the question "Does the subject/caregiver currently have any of the following diagnoses?"
matched_top_1_cdm_definition: Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR) Sum of Boxes.
matched_top_1_cdm_variable: Clinical Dementia Rating Scale Sum of Boxes (CDRSB)

cohort_definition: Flag variable for the answer to "Has the subject had any falls since the last data collection (or in the last three months at the baseline observation)?"
matched_top_1_cdm_definition: Functional Activities Questionnaire (FAQ) Keeping track of current events.
matched_top_1_cdm_variable: FAQ - Keep Track of Current Events

cohort_definition: Flag variable for a YES answer to any of the questions "Is the subject currently taking any psychiatric/hypnotic treatments?/ Has the subject taken any psychiatric/hypnotic treatment since baseline?/ Has the subject taken any psychiatric/hypnotic treatment since the last visit?"
matched_top_1_cdm_definition: Functional Activities Questionnaire (FAQ) Remembering appointments, family occasions, holidays, medications.

cohort_definition: Indicator variable for MMSE Item correct response; if MMSE Item is Total Score, value ranges from 0-30
NPI Item Result Numeric (See documentation in Other Resources in ADDI GERAS-EU dataset description)
matched_top_1_cdm_definition: Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI) Total of (Frequency Sub-total) x (Severity Sub-total).
